ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The volume of readings is unrealistic. A shorter list would mean we could all discuss the same readings.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The course was very well organized, it was clear what we were covering and where we were going. The readings were well chose and supported the topic well, and provided balanced viewpoints.
A lot of assigned readings, but they were really thoughtfully assembled and worthwhile.

Professor Burroughs is very knowledgeable. While I enjoyed the student presentations each class, I wouldhave liked more lecturing from Professor Burroughs.The group project was a very good learning experience and quite realistic. The project seemed to happen very fast, I wish there was a just a bit more time to let the process sink in.
The group project was excellent and I feel like I really developed some expertise on a topic.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The final project is great in theory but our group struggled in execution. The assignment was vague, and I think we would have benefited from a clearer direction and geographic situation.

Some of the instructions for the final project could have been clearer. There were also aspects of the final assignment that were not as concrete as I would have liked, but I think that was due to the topic assigned.
I would have been interested in spending a little less time on sector-by-sector studies and more time on broader US and international ocean policy.
The discussions sometimes wander off. A clearer structure to the lectures with slides would help keep things on track. I thought there was an overemphasis on conceptual models of policy-making.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course was central to my area of relevance, and I gained a lot of insight into and understanding of coastal policy and governance
This course is probably the most relevant FES offering to my overall program. I wish there were more marine issues courses like it at FES.
Right in the middle. Critical to what I want to do after graduating.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Coastal governance is a main interest of mine
To improve my knowledge of how a coastline can be managed and how competing interests can be balanced.
see above
Heard good reviews and they were well founded!

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, although I didn't feel that I didn't get as much our of the final product as I could have.
Absolutely. Learned a lot, and Professor Burroughs is a very good instructor.
Yes. I wish there were time in the semester to dig deeper into some of the material presented!
Absolutely.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantages:Disadvantages: different work ethics, some group members only work under pressure, other prefer to do the assignment in advance. How we allocated work did not sufficiently let people work in their own time, partly because the assignment was so open and vague. It was difficult to coordinate.
Clearer deliverables and adding some example projects could help with the group project. Perhaps assigning team leaders could make the process go more smoothly.
We had a great group and I learned a ton from my colleagues.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Get stuck in to the final project as early as possible, and assign a group leader.
Take it!
This is a very good course taught by a well-respected professor in the field. Soak it up!
Take it if you are interested in learning about the laws that govern the coasts, you're interested in policy-making or marine issues.
